thread.title: Supreme Court Appears Divided Over Case Involving U.S. Border Agent Shooting Mexican Teen - WSJ
thread.title_full: Supreme Court Appears Divided Over Case Involving U.S. Border Agent Shooting Mexican Teen - WSJ

author: Jess Bravin
title: Supreme Court Appears Divided Over Case Involving U.S. Border Agent Shooting Mexican Teen - WSJ
text:
Politics Supreme Court Appears Divided Over Case Involving U.S. Border Agent Shooting Mexican Teen Federal law allows lawsuit if victim was on U.S. side, but boy was on Mexican side of boundary By ByJessBravin Updated Feb. 21, 2017 5:33 p.m. ET 
WASHINGTON—The Supreme Court appeared divided Tuesday over whether a U.S. Border Patrol agent can be sued for fatally shooting an unarmed Mexican teenager who stood on the other side of the international border—a lawsuit federal law would permit, had the victim been on the U.S. side of the boundary. 
The 2010 incident, in which 15-year-old Sergio Hernandez died in a dry Rio Grande culvert that separates the U.S. from Mexico, is one of hundreds of Border Patrol shootings in recent years, including several cross-border... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
